instructions.do: Dice or shred your cooked chicken
Chop onions, garlic, and green onions
Beat the eggs in a small bowl
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat
Pour in the eggs and scramble until just cooked
Remove and set aside
Add the remaining 1 tbsp oil to the pan
Sauté the onion, garlic, and ginger for 1–2 minutes until fragrant
Add peas and carrots, and cook for another 2–3 minutes
Turn the heat to high
Add the cold rice and chicken
Stir-fry everything together for 2–3 minutes, breaking up clumps of rice
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), and sesame oil
Return the scrambled eggs to the pan
Mix thoroughly and cook another 1–2 minutes until well combined
Add sliced green onions (green parts only)
Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper

ingredients.products: 2 cups cooked rice (preferably cold, day-old rice)
2 green onions, sliced (optional, for garnish and flavor)
Salt and black pepper, to taste
2 tbsp vegetable oil (or any neutral oil)

instructions.do: Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add the beaten eggs and cook, stirring gently until just set.
Remove from the pan and set aside.
Add another 1 tbsp of oil.
Sauté the onion and garlic until fragrant (about 1–2 minutes).
Add peas and carrots, and stir-fry until tender (2–3 minutes).
Increase the heat to high.
Add the cold rice and break apart any clumps.
Stir-fry everything for 2–3 minutes until heated through and well mixed.
Add soy sauce, sesame oil, and scrambled eggs.
Toss everything together until evenly coated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add sliced green onions just before serving for freshness and flavor.

ingredients.products: 2 cups cooked rice (preferably cold/day-old for best texture)
2 spring onions, chopped (white and green parts separated)
Salt and black pepper, to taste
2 tbsp vegetable oil or sesame oil

instructions.do: Wash and finely chop all vegetables
Make sure your rice is cold and separated (not clumpy)
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large wok or pan over medium-high heat
Add garlic, ginger, and white part of spring onions
Stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant
Add all chopped veggies: carrots, beans, peppers, peas, cabbage
Stir-fry on high heat for 3–5 minutes until slightly tender but still crisp
Add the cold rice
Stir-fry for another 2–3 minutes, breaking up any clumps
Add soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, salt, and pepper
Mix everything well until the rice is evenly coated
Add the green parts of spring onions
Toss once more and turn off the heat
